source.name: The 2011 Survey of State Mental Health Agencies
source.description:
This survey is conducted by the Vocational Rehabilitation - Rehabilitation Research and Training Center (VR-RRTC) at the Institute for Community Inclusion / University of Massachusetts Boston (ICI / UMB). The research is jointly funded by the National Institute on Disability and Rehabilitation Research (NIDRR) and the Rehabilitation Services Administration (RSA).

The purpose of the survey is to better understand how Mental Health (MH) agencies operate within states and how this differs across states by collecting information on MH agency characteristics. This information will be used to develop state-by-state maps of interagency partnerships and public employment service delivery, highlighting the role of MH within this constellation. The information collected will not be evaluated in any way but used for descriptive purposes only. Survey findings will be made available to all survey respondents in printed and electronic format through the VR-RRTC website (www.VR-RRTC.org).
